intro: Galium glabrescens subsp. josephinense, commonly known as the Josephine bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves distinguish it from other members of the Galium genus.
